required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Followup of Glenoid Fix Utilizing Auto Bone Graft in Shoulder Replacement
clinical_study.official_title: Computed Tomographic and Functional Follow-up of Glenoid Anchor Peg Component Fixation Utilizing Autologous Bone Graft in Total Shoulder Arthroplasty

brief_summary.textblock: To investigate if the use of autologous bone graft around the anchor-peg glenoid prosthesis correlates with bony apposition on computed tomography scans, decreased radiolucent lines and component loosening, and functional outcomes. We hypothesize that by utilizing autologous bone graft from the resected humeral head, placed around the anchor peg glenoid prosthesis at implantation, there is a low incidence of glenoid loosening. We suggest that the absence of radiolucent lines correlated with excellent shoulder function.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a case study to evaluate the adequacy of fixation and functional outcome of the glenoid anchor peg following autologous bone grafting around the prosthesis at the time of implant.

primary_outcome.measure: To determine if the use of autologous bone graft around the anchor-peg glenoid prosthesis correlate with bony apposition on computed tomography scans, decreased radiolucent lines and component loosening, and functional outcomes.
primary_outcome.time_frame: case study over approximate 3 months time.

arm_group.description: Patients who received a total shoulder replacement with an anchor peg glenoid and autologous bone grafting from the investigator of this study will be recruited for this study.

study_pop.textblock: Maximum number will be 70. Patients who received a total shoulder replacement with an anchor peg glenoid and autologous bone grafting from the investigator of this study will be recruited for this study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients who received a total shoulder replacement with an anchor peg glenoid and autologous bone grafting from the investigator of this study will be recruited for this study.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients will be excluded if they are unable to comprehend the consent information.
- Pregnant women will be excluded from this study.

facility.name: University of Nebraska Medical Center - Dept of Orhtopaedic Surgery
University of Nebraska Medical Center, Dept. of Orthopaedic Surgery
